description: News and reaction to the impact of coronavirus on Jersey and other top stories.
title: Coronavirus: Jersey updates and other news 5-9 October
title_page: Coronavirus: Jersey updates and other news 5-9 October - BBC News
maintext:
BBC Copyright: BBC
Islanders are being advised to not take their children trick or treating at Halloween due to the coronavirus pandemic.
Door-to-door visits are not being recommended by Public Health because it could be tricky to maintain 1m (3ft 3in) physical distancing and handing out sweets and touching doorbells could risk spreading the virus.
For people planning parties in Jersey, the States is reminding people that gatherings are limited to under 20 people and any indoor meeting is considered high risk.
The deputy medical officer of health, Dr Ivan Muscat said: ¡°Although it is not thought that children are the main drivers of Covid, they can still spread the virus and face-to-face exposure with strangers, while trick or treating, poses more of a risk of spread to islanders."
Throughout October, the government will be sharing ideas on social media for anyone intending to mark Halloween this year.
Some of the alternative ideas include pumpkin carving and a scavenger hunt outside.
